Adding books by ISBN is much more accurate than adding by author and title and is generally preferred. Please remember you can sometimes find the correct barcode on the inside front cover.
You can use this screen to customize the list of styles that will be displayed in your default styles menu. A “tick” indicates the style will be shown in the list, “un-tick” to hide it and vice versa. If no styles are ticked, then all styles will be shown. You can re-order the hierarchy by dragging the icon at the extreme right of each row up or down. Long-pressing anywhere else in a row will allow you to edit or clone the details of a specific style. If you cloned a style, and changed your mind, you will need to delete it yourself.
You can use this screen to modify the hierarchy of headings for a specific booklist style. A “tick” indicates the heading will be shown in the list, “un-tick” to hide it and vice versa. You can re-order the hierarchy by dragging the icon at the extreme right of each row up or down.
You can use this screen to set the characteristics of a specific booklist style. You can change the name, edit the groupings to change the hierarchy, and adjust a variety of other preferences to build a style that you find useful. It is also possible to use filters to modify the selection of books that will be displayed in the list. e.g. to only retrieve books you have not read yet and more.
If shown for every author, a single book may appear more than once in a list. In such a case deleting one of those books will delete all instances from the list.
If shown in every series, a single book may appear more than once in a list. In such a case deleting one of those books will delete all instances from the list.
From here you can see the currently running tasks as well as previous tasks that have completed with errors or other notable events. Tapping on a task will allow you to see the events associated with that task as well as delete the task (and related events).
From here you can see the events associated with a background task. Tapping on a event will allow you to perform a variety of actions appropriate for that event.
This menu allows you to select the style of the list. You can also customize this menu, as well as create your own list styles, by tapping “Customize” at the end of the list.
If you find yourself always rotating camera images in the same direction, try changing the application preferences to specify a rotation to apply automatically.
You can swipe left or right to navigate to other books.
Tapping on a book will show you the details of the book. A long-press on an item in the list will give you more options.

Goodreads is a web site whose stated mission is “to help people find and share books they love”. They have an extensive database of books and reviews, and if you are a registered Goodreads user, &APP_NAME; can export your books, shelves and reviews to Goodreads and import your books, shelves and reviews from Goodreads. &APP_NAME; is a stand-alone application and does not require Goodreads, but if you are interested you can register at:
Once you are registered, or if you are already a Goodreads user, you can authorize &APP_NAME; access your Goodreads data by pressing the button below. It will take you to a web page where you will need to login to Goodreads and authorize this application. We will never see your password, and you can disable access via the Goodreads website. Due to the vagaries of the web, you may end up on a blank web page. Just tap the back button to return here!
But remember…there is no need to do any of this: &APP_NAME; works just fine without it!

This will send your library to Goodreads.\n \nYou can choose to send all of your books, or only the books you have updated since they were last copied to or from Goodreads (including all books that have not been sent yet) or you can cancel the update.\n \nIf you have never sent any books then there is no difference between the first two options.
The selected book does not have an ISBN; it is not possible to automatically synchronize it with Goodreads. The simplest solution is to:\n \n(1) delete the book from &APP_NAME;\n \n(2) add the book in Goodreads manually via their web interface\n \n(3) Synchronize with Goodreads\n \nThis will result in the book being recreated in &APP_NAME; and the two will remain linked from that point onwards.
The ISBN of the selected book could not be found on Goodreads. There are two possible causes for this: either the data for the book is wrong (you should check the ISBN), or the book is not in Goodreads.\n \nIf you make any changes to the data in &APP_NAME;, just press the “Retry” button and check to see if the resulting background task succeeds.\n \nIf the data looks correct and the book is still not found, then a book with that ISBN needs to be added to Goodreads manually via their web site. Once that is done, you can retry sending the book.
